title: NETWORK_ADD_MAP_ENTITY_TO_SYNCHRONISED_SCENE
content:
0x45F35C0EDC33B03B// NetworkAddMapEntityToSynchronisedScene
void NETWORK_ADD_MAP_ENTITY_TO_SYNCHRONISED_SCENE(int netScene, Hash modelHash, float x, float y, float z, char* animDict, char* animName, float blendInSpeed, float blendOutSpeed, int flags);Parameters:netScene: Net scene ID returned by NETWORK_CREATE_SYNCHRONISED_SCENEmodelHash: Model hash of the object the script should look for.x: Object X coord.y: Object Y coord.z: Object Z coord.animDict: Anim dictionary to play on this object.animName: Anim name to play on this object.blendInSpeed: Float representing how quickly the animation should be blended into. Default is 8.0.blendOutSpeed: Float representing how quickly the animation should be blended out of. Default is -8.0flags: See NETWORK_ADD_PED_TO_SYNCHRONISED_SCENE.Adds a map entity to a network synchronized scene. This native function is utilized only once as of game build 2944 within the casino_slots script.
Please note that it's only possible to add a single map entity to synchronised scenes.It's advisable to initially locate the object and retrieve its actual coordinates using GET_CLOSEST_OBJECT_OF_TYPE.NativeDB Introduced: v1734
codeBlocks:
// NetworkAddMapEntityToSynchronisedScene
